sources.title: "A Tin-Type Romance" (1910) starring Florence Turner
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation   We have included this film in our program to illustrate the work and contributions of Florence Turner, a star of Silent Hall of Fame.  "A Tin-Type Romance" is a short romantic comedy. A lonely girl decides to attract a man on the beach.   Directed by                       unknown Cinematography by         unknown Starring                             Florence Turner,  Leo Delaney Distributed by                   Vitagraph Company Release date                      December 6, 1910 Country                             United States Running time                    9 m.   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Plot: Phil and Beth meet at the beach and shortly exchange tintypes, which they wear in lockets. When she spots the locket on his fob and asks "Whose picture is that?" the catch sticks and he cannot prove it is hers. They quarrel and separate. Each determines to commit suicide, but the water is too cold. Fortunately, Jean the Vitagraph Dog acts as an intermediary and they are soon reconciled.
